column4: i'm using ubuntu8.10 x64, and i used to be able to connect online through the wireless connection, but suddenly now, i cant.  can someone help me?
lspci
the wireless network is detected, but when i attempt to connect, it just stays with two green dots forever.  i can connect online using the same laptop when booting into windows tho.
tons of 64 bit CPUs come with 32 bit OS? I dont get it
uninstall and reinstall the driver
how would i do this? im just using the default driver that ubuntu installed
in synaptic package manager
its in the added programs somewhere i think
thanks, ill take a look
make sure its not a silly error like your networking is turned off or something, geotsai
it attempts to connect, but is stuck at something like 'determining ip address' or something like that
thats strange
reset the router
i was actually just wondering if there was a way to reinstall everything that has to do with networking and start from scratch. is there a way?
i've done everything including trying different wireless connections etc.  same result
hmm
unplug the router and the base computer and turn it back  on, geotsai
furthermore, it works perfectly in windows, so its isolated in ubuntu.  it doesnt appear to be driver based because it discoveres the network, but cant connect
you've got me stumped, sorry
thansk for your help anyway
welcome
